INIT.message: These are some of the available EGO program mentors based on the rumours your friends have collected. Who would you rather have?

psych.message: Unfortunately, the school randomly assigns mentors to students and does not take specific teacher requests, as the school believes in exposing students to a variety of teaching and learning styles.

Continue.title: Pistole offers a wide range of opportunities.
Continue.subtitle: A work of fiction, &c.

pole-intro.message: A 1769 expedition party encounters a troublesome metal rod mysteriously found erected on the ground; it had impaled the party’s main wagon, so the expeditioners camped nearby for several days for repairs. What should they do to the pole?

Remove the pole to avoid further casualt.message: The members agree to pull out the pole; however, they cannot resist the temptation to found a town around it. The resulting town is aptly named Vertically Challenging Pole. Meanwhile, several attempts are made to remove the pole, but all fail; consequently, the members suffer major injuries and give up. The pole will later be toppled over by an unmanned vehicle in 1983.

ego-intro.message: Pistole High School, established in 1964, is a humble high school in Vertically Challenging Pole. As one of the top schools in the nation, with two thousand students attending each year, parents flock from around the world just to send their kids to the school. This has led to a spike in academic stress on the students, which the school administration intends on reducing.

Establish Mr. Etresfeul, a teacher with.message: The school initiates the EGO program (_E_xercise, _G_ood night's sleep, and _O_mm--three of the seventy-six easy-to-remember tips for reducing stress that would be taught in the program). When should EGO sessions take place?

During lunch.message: Students need to eat and attend clubs!

After school.message: This would cause problems with students with after-school activities.

During the latter of the two weekly free.message: The school enthusiastically commends this idea. Of course, teachers participating in the EGO program will not be available to non-EGO students, but this can be resolved later.

Continue.message:
They decide the sessions would only meet once a week for half a period, compared to the other periods occurring multiple times a week, as to not seem too intrusive. To encourage relationship building, the students will be randomly grouped into isolated cohorts, which are to remain the same throughout high school, for cohort members to grow more familiar with each other than they would with their classmates in other classes.
In addition to eliminating stress, it will also teach important virtues such as the equal treatment of all students, no matter their race, sexuality, or age. Which grades should have mandatory participation?

All grades.message: There are not enough mentors for all the EGO cohorts.

begin-story.message:
The first week as a high school freshman is a week of new experiences, so, of course, one should try to experience as many new things as possible. However, not even the introductory freshman initiation camp volunteers could have predicted the school’s decision to not introduce the freshmen to the new freedoms granted by the free periods but rather present their new EGO programs.
None of the older students know much about the new EGO program for freshmen, so you arrive two minutes late to your class. What should you say?

“I, Nevets Eux, am present!”.message: Your classmates stare at you. Apparently, your mentor has decided to do attendance near the end of the period because it was your second day of high school.

Remain silent..message: Your mentor does not notice your arrival and marks you absent.

intro-bagne.message:
Your mentor briefly introduces herself in a businesslike manner as Ms. Bagne, who attended a small community college in the north. She then pulls up a branded slide presentation about greetings.
	“Please have your students write their names on the provided index cards in a colour that suits them best,” she reads from the bullet points. She then has some students distribute the index cards and sharpies. What colour will you write your name in?

White.message: White won’t show on the index cards, silly!

cohort-intro.message:
Ms. Bagne only has black sharpies, so you write your name in black. She collects the index cards and continues reading off the slides.
	“Have your students introduce themselves by stating their name and favourite food.”
	Which of your favourite foods will you say?

cohort-intro-2.message: Ms. Bagne pulls names randomly from her freshly made stack of index cards, complimenting everyone’s food tastes. Suddenly, a specific food item launches the class--the three debate students--into a discussion that quickly transforms into a debate over a controversial political issue in the nation. Concerned for time, Bagne interrupts their conversation to continue their introductions, but the bell rings before she gets to you.

Continue.message:
#Two days later: the second ~free period~ EGO session
An urgent misfortune has come to your attention. Your math teacher has announced both in class and online that a readiness examination will be administered for credit today after the EGO sessions. Unfortunately, you did not pay attention in class nor check online, and you have largely forgotten the formulas learnt the previous year. While the older students leisurely relax in their free periods, studying or entertaining themselves, you must trudge to your EGO cohort classroom.
What shall be done with the math exam?

Request permission to study from Ms. Bag.message: Ms. Bagne tuts at you disappointedly. “It is your responsibility to be informed and study outside of school, not during class time. Please return to your seat.”

study-discreetly.message: Ms. Bagne immediately catches you as she starts class. She calls you up, confiscates your studying materials: your math notebook, phone, and pencil, and declares, “You may retrieve your belongings from the office at the end of school. Let this be a lesson to all of you!”

Continue.message:
Your insufficient studying results in failing the exam. With a quick summoning from the counselling office, you are dropped to the math lane below. Your parents do not hesitate to express their disappointment.
After school, you discover that Ms. Bagne had only returned his phone. The following EGO session, you request your belongs back from Ms. Bagne, but she says she has lost them.

dont-study.message: The passing period was insufficient, and you fail the exam. With a quick summoning from the counselling office, you are dropped to the math lane below. Your parents do not hesitate to express their disappointment.

october.message:
#October
Mr. Angleon warmly welcomes his students in, calling out “How are you?” and greeting them by name as he casually sits on a stool. With a quick glance over the classroom, attendance was dealt with, and he starts with his math lesson. Students regularly ask thought-provoking questions throughout, and when he presents them a problem, they enthusiastically chatter over possible and alternative solutions. At times...
